meanings.definition: Decayed organic material used as a plant fertilizer.
meanings.sent1: I spread compost on my garden to help my plants grow.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used compost to enrich the soil in his fields.
meanings.sent3: The compost made the flowers so happy, they bloomed extra bright!
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a beautiful tapestry of colors, nourished by the compost she made.
meanings.sent5: The compost smelled earthy and rich, promising a bountiful harvest.

meanings.sent1: I compost my kitchen scraps to create nutrient-rich soil.
meanings.sent2: She loves to compost her food waste to reduce landfill waste.
meanings.sent3: He decided to compost his failed attempts at baking bread.
meanings.sent4: She composted her old ideas and grew a new perspective.
meanings.sent5: Composting is a simple way to give back to the earth and reduce waste.

meanings.definition: A mixture of various decaying organic substances.
meanings.sent1: The compost in the bin smelled like a mix of earth and leaves.
meanings.sent2: The gardener added kitchen scraps to the compost pile to create a rich mixture.
meanings.sent3: The compost heap in the backyard was a buffet for curious critters.
meanings.sent4: The compost bin was a treasure trove of nutrients waiting to be used.
meanings.sent5: The compost pile was a bustling community of decomposers breaking down organic matter.
